ca.corefacility.gview.utils.thread

Class ThreadService

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.corefacility.gview.utils.thread.ThreadService

  • public class ThreadService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a collection of utilities for executing runnables on threads.
    Author:
    Eric Marinier

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void executeOnEDT(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      This class will execute the passed runnable on the Swing Event Dispatch Thread or the current thread if the current thread is the Swing Event Dispatch Thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadService

        public ThreadService()

    • Method Detail

      • getRanges

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ThreadRange> getRanges(int count)
        This method will return a list of equal ranges, determined by the passed count parameter and the number of active threads.
        Parameters:
        count - The total number of items to be divided over the threads.
        Returns:
        A list of equal ranges. More specifically, each range will contain (count / threads) items and the first (count % threads) items will contain an extra item. The ranges will be organized in ascending order.

      • setNumThreads

        public static void setNumThreads(int threads)
        Sets the number of threads to use. WARNING: This should be called as early as possible and ideally before any threads have ever begun execution.
        Parameters:
        threads - The number of the threads to use.

      • invokeAll

        public static java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object>> invokeAll(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Object>> callables)
        Invokes all the callables and returns a list of their Future objects or NULL list if there was an exception.
        Parameters:
        callables - The callables to invoke.

      • executeOnEDT

        public static void executeOnEDT(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        This class will execute the passed runnable on the Swing Event Dispatch Thread or the current thread if the current thread is the Swing Event Dispatch Thread. In either case, the Runnable will be executed SYNCHRONOUSLY.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The runnable object to run.
